result.execSummary:
The defendant Devell A Allison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May be transferred to Florida if they will accept same. This matter may not be expunged.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution must be made during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

CORRECTED TO MARK RESTITUTION JOINT AND SEVERAL

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No contact with any branches of the victim bank branches in the State of Wisconsin. No contact with co-actor. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devell A Allison in court, via speakerphone, with attorney Richard Joseph Albanese, in person.  Patricia Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent Chapman appeared.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
State of FL won't accept probation on an interstate compact.
Agent is satisfied with phone supervision so far.
Atty Albanese req that supervision be terminated.
State takes no position.
BTC:  Probation to continue with long distance supervision.
Probation review hearing on May 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devell A Allison not in court.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.  Probation Agent Patrick Chapman also appears.
Probation transfer to Florida not possible; defendant does not meet the criteria.  Defendant stays in Florida.  Appears to agent every 3 months.  Attorney Albanese contacted by telephone and appears via speaker phone.  Atty had advised defendant speak with agent and try to resolve it.  Atty was not subsequently contacted and thought matter had been resolved.  
BTC:  matter to be rescheduled.  Defendant may appear by speaker phone.  Probation review hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Probation review hearing on April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devell A Allison in court with attorney Richard Joseph Albanese.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. The State files and amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt/waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Upon plea to charges in amended info, the State recommends w/held sentence with period of prob.
P-NC to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. Sent w/held on both counts - 1 yr probation. May be transferred to Florida if they will accept same. The Court will not expunge this matter

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
restitution - $150.00 to Johnson Bank - j/s
No contact with any branches of the victim bank institutions in the State of Wisconsin
no contact with co-actor
From ATTY Albanese re: non-appearance in court

Defendant Devell A Allison in court.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
Attorney Albanese did not appear. Both the defendant's mother and the Court attempted to contact the attorney and the call went directly to voicemail. The Defendant indicates that the attorney was aware of the hearing as he met with the defendant recently.

BTC: New date given for PLEAS  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Devell A Allison in court with attorney Richard Joseph Albanese.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.   No contact with victim store except for restitution purposes. North Shore Bank.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Devell A Allison in court with attorney Richard Joseph Albanese.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
BTC: Vacate Warrant
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 08-20-2015 01:30 pm
Warrant forwarded to RCSO for entry.
